title: Lucene release artifacts should be named apache-lucene-*
description: Our artifact names should be prefixed with apache-, as in apache-lucene-4.0-src.tar.gz (or whatever)

comments.content:
i also seem to recall that most projects put the "apache-" prefix on the jar names as well .. but i may be imagining that.

something to think about anyway.
comments.author: Hoss Man

comments.content:
i also seem to recall that most projects put the "apache-" prefix on the jar names as well .. but i may be imagining that

out of all the apache jars in lucene/solr (and we have quite a lot), the only ones that do this are apache-solr-xxx jars themselves, but no other jars from any other projects.
comments.author: Robert Muir

comments.content: Yeah, I don't think we need to name the jars as such, but the containers (tarballs, etc.) and the directory they are unpackaged into should be.
comments.author: Grant Ingersoll

comments.content: Is there really an apache policy that requires this? we've been releasing for a while without this prefix: so i'm unsetting blocker.
comments.author: Robert Muir

comments.content: Grant, can we resolve this as WONTFIX?
comments.author: Steve Rowe

comments.content:
apache httpd's artifacts arent even prefixed with apache (just httpd-xxx.tar.gz)

So, I don't think we need to change any naming here.
comments.author: Robert Muir
